name: Mayda Del Valle
bio: Mayda Del Valle has been described by the Chicago Sun Times as having “a way with words. Sometimes they seem to flutter and roll off her lips. Other times they burst forth like a comet streaking across a nighttime sky.” Del Valle has appeared in Urban Latino, Latina Magazine, Mass Appeal, The Source, and the New York Times. Smithsonian Magazine chose her as one of  “America’s Young Innovators in the Arts and Sciences” and Oprah’s O Magazine named her as one of 20 women for the first ever “O Power List.” A proud native of the South Side of Chicago, she has appeared on 6 episodes of Russell Simmons Def Poetry Jam on HBO and was a contributing writer and original cast member of the Tony Award winning Def Poetry Jam on Broadway. She also toured with Norman Lear’s Declare Yourself  Spoken Word Tour , a non-profit, non-partisan project created to encourage young voter registration for the 2004 presidential elections. In May of 2009 she was invited to perform at The White House for the President and First Lady.
